Characteristics of a Good Hypothesis

Match the items on the left to the correct areas on the right.

drops.title: Characteristics of a Good Hypothesis
drops.drop:
1. If the plants carry out photosynthesis, then they must have
     underground roots.

2. A decrease in the amount of nitrogen in the soil will lead to
     an increase in the rate of photosynthesis in Brassica rapa
     plants.

3. If you increase the temperature and the concentration of
     carbon dioxide, then the rate of photosynthesis will
     increase.

4. If you increase the intensity of the sun, then the rate of
     photosynthesis in all plants will increase.

multiple.question: Based on the data, which of the following is the best way to revise the original hypothesis?

answers.answer: If the concentration of carbon dioxide is increased, then the rate of photosynthesis will decrease.
If the rate of carbon dioxide is increased, then the rate of photosynthesis will increase up to a certain point.

multiple.question: Having a good hypothesis is the first step in the design of a good experiment.
A scientific hypothesis is the same as an educated guess.
A good hypothesis can have as many variables as are testable.
A good hypothesis shows a cause and effect relationship between the two variables.
Data can only prove a hypothesis to be true.
What is the flaw in this hypothesis? If the number of swimmers attending pools during the summer increases, then the temperature outside will increase.
What is the flaw in this hypothesis? A reaction takes place faster when you heat the solution.

answers.answer: It does not include two variables.
It is not stated using the "If-then" format.

multiple.question: In this hypothesis, which statement correctly describes the variables? If you increase the amount of sunlight a bean plant receives, then the plant will grow taller.

answers.answer: The height of the bean plant is the only dependent variable.
The height of the bean plant and the amount of sunlight are both dependent variables.

multiple.question: Which statement shows a cause-effect relationship?

answers.answer: Blue flowers and white flowers appear at the same ratio in the tested area of the meadow.
If the bean plants receive fertilizer, then they will produce more beans.

multiple.question: A student measures the mass of four potato cores before placing them each in beakers of solutions with increasing sucrose concentrations. The potatoes remain in the sucrose solutions for 24 hours and then their mass is measured again to determine the percent change in mass. Which of the following hypotheses is being tested?

answers.answer: If you increase the sucrose concentration in each of the beakers, then the percent mass change in the potatoes will go down.
If you decrease the sucrose concentration and change the shape of the potatoes, then the percent mass change in the potatoes will go down.
